result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Knight

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Michelle Knight. Defendant Michelle Knight appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. On State's motion count 2 is dismissed and read in. DE pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds DE guilty of count 1. PSI ordered. State to prepare writ for SEH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
With Christina at Taycheedah a zoom appearance has been arranged for 10/27/22 at 8:30.

Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Michelle Knight. Defendant Michelle Knight appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Rose advises this case is resolved. PLEAH set.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
With Christina/Taycheedah a zoom appearance has been arranged for 10/21/22 at 9:30.

Due to the ongoing trial in br 2 the JPTC of 06/17/22 at 9:30 has been adjourned with Attorney C. Rose to 07/28/22 at 10:00.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney C. Rose who appeared by zoom. Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Rose's bond motion. Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.
